derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as extirpation): from Latin exstirpare, from ex- 'out' + stirps 'a stem'

means.word_mean: 1. destroy completely, as if down to the roots;

sentences.sentence: "the vestiges of political democracy were soon uprooted"

means.word_mean: 2. pull up by or as if by the roots;

sentences.sentence: "uproot the vine that has spread all over the garden"
